result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody A. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall be paid during the term of supervision on 14CF20

Shall serve 90 days DCJ w/h&t commencing on/before 8/20/14
Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody A. Anderson

defendant.name: Anderson, Cody A.
defendant.address: 1224 Tom Mede Dr, Beaver Dam, WI 53916

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: (10:03) Defendant Cody A. Anderson in court, in custody with attorney David Zarwell. Kurt Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is motion to revoke DPA filed by State; State heard - will not proceed today with motion to revoke - has reached agreement with Atty. Zarwell for conditions for Def. to meet; State requests this be postponed 30-45 days; Atty. Zarwell heard - Def. sitting 90 days on conditional jail on 14CF20, does have huber for treatment; requests huber for employment; State now heard on restitution and requests correct filled in form; Court notes there isn't one, amounts were noted on the record at the hearing; Court prints out order and fills in amounts - will be refiled; cases 14CF20 and 14CF146 also called; Court notes that issues on those cases were not scheduled to be called today; discussion held; Court now calls 14CF20 to address the issue of huber; Court amends the conditional jail time to include huber for employment and treatment for balance of sentence; this case is rescheduled for 6/23/15 at 1:00pm

Case called along with 14CF20 and 14CF146.  Defendant Cody A. Anderson in Court with Attorney David Zarwell.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Restitution Hearing. Victims Rights are compliant.  Parties stipulate to using the DPA in 13CF383 and will add restitution amounts to that document on the record.  Parties stipulate to no rest. in 14CF146, in 13CF383, $289.98 is stipulated to for the victim in this case-victim was present and agreeable, and as to 14CFCF20 is owed to victim Dylan Turner, per stipulation.   These amounts are to be added to the JOC.  Attorney Zarwell asked for credit in 14CF167, case then called by the Court.   Defendant pled to a a misd. in that case. Attorney Zarwell recited the days of credit on three cases:  13CF383, one day of presentence credit, to be applied against any revocation;  in 14CF20, one day of presentence credit to be applied against any revocation; and in 14CF167,  seven days of presetence credit, however, no jail was ordered in that case.
Restitution hearing on September 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Cases called 13CF383, 14CF20, 14CF146, 14CF167.  Defendant Cody A. Anderson in court with attorney David Zarwell.   Kurt Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arraignment is on 14CF146- Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered;  - all cases to be set for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 19, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference on June 16, 2014 at 12:30 pm.

13CF383 & 14CF20 & 14CF146 - Defendant Cody A. Anderson in court with attorney David Zarwell.  Kurt F Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Zarwell is on first 2 cases; Atty Wineke was recently appointed on 146 case. DA Klomberg requests adjournment. Court attempts to contact Atty Wineke - no answer. Court schedules all 3 cases for a TSC in 2 weeks.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 12:30 pm.

12:49 - Defendant Cody A. Anderson in court, in custody with attorney Greg E Vollan (eligible).  Yolanda J Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $1000 PA Bond without specific conditions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
10:42 - ADA Tienstra for State. Def FTA. Court issues WA; finds probable cause.
